JUDGES: Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently detained in FAC . He was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
DATE until DATE the applicant has been detained in FAC .

The applicant submitted that he was held in a cell which was designed for CARDINAL prisoners and measured CARDINAL m² . The cell was initially furnished with CARDINAL beds , CARDINAL stools , CARDINAL small tables and CARDINAL cupboards . A toilet annex was in the corner of the cell .

From DATE to DATE , the cell was occupied by CARDINAL detainees , including the applicant . From DATE until an unspecified date , it was shared by CARDINAL inmates , including the applicant . A fourth bed was added .

The Government submitted that on an unspecified date , presumably in DATE , the applicant had been placed in a cell in which the statutory minimum standard of CARDINAL m² per person was respected . The applicant did not contest this submission .
The applicant lodged a number of complaints with the ORG authorities and the remand centre ’s administration about the overcrowding .

By letter of DATE the Deputy Governor of ORG informed the applicant that his complaint had been considered illfounded . It was stated that the situation in FAC was no different from that in the rest of the country , since overcrowding was a general problem in NORP detention facilities .
The applicant did not bring a civil action to seek compensation for the infringement of his personal rights .
( See PERSON and CARDINAL other applications v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
